key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel saw missing offers jump to 12.5%, driving parity down to 87.5% week-over-week, though actual price variances remain under 0.2%.
MSE listings were unavailable for 11.8% of routes as lower pricing dominated 88.2% of offers with average discounts of 0.10%, and no parity or premiums occurred.

key_channel_insights.line_title: GDS Missing Offers Rise Amid Strong Parity
key_channel_insights.line_content: GDS experienced 11.8% missing itineraries and maintained 87.5% parity despite week-over-week declines, with undercutting cases below 1%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA channel missing rate climbed to 12.5% of itineraries last week, up +5.96 pp week-over-week and +10.5 pp month-over-month, indicating more website-only availability.
Price parity still applies to 87.5% of itineraries last week but has slipped by –5.96 pp versus the prior week and –7.83 pp versus last month.
When OTA fares differ, premiums average just +0.13% and discounts around –0.16%, reflecting minimal divergence from website pricing.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Itineraries missing on OTA reached 12.5% last week versus 6.5% the week before, marking a significant +5.96 pp increase.
'Same' fares dropped to 87.5% of listings last week from 93.5% the prior week, a –5.96 pp shift pointing to creeping divergence.
OTA-higher occurrences remain at 0% frequency last week and month, with an average premium of just +0.13% when present.
OTA-lower frequency was 0% last week and only 2.67% last month, with mean discounts of –0.16%, underscoring scarcity of lower OTA fares.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul missing offers rose to 14.56% last week (+7.83 pp week-over-week, +12.64 pp month-over-month), though parity remains high at 85.44%.
Long-haul routes show 8.16% missing last week (+2.04 pp week-over-week, +6.04 pp month-over-month) with parity at 91.84%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes from Iceland saw missing OTA offers climb to 18.09% last week (+8.41 pp week-over-week, +15.89 pp month-over-month), reducing parity to 81.91%.
Non-Iceland origins maintain low gaps at 3.39% last week (+1.72 pp week-over-week, +3.39 pp month-over-month) and high parity at 96.61%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings experienced 14.95% missing offers last week (+6.22 pp week-over-week, +12.99 pp month-over-month) and 85.05% parity.
Far-out bookings show only 4.44% missing offers last week (+2.44 pp week-over-week, +4.44 pp month-over-month) with 95.56% price parity.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE listings were unavailable for 11.8% of OD pairs last week, up 5.3 pp weekly and 9.8 pp monthly, indicating a drop in distribution coverage.
88.2% of itineraries on MSE were priced below the website last week, though this share declined by 5.3 pp week-on-week and 9.8 pp month-on-month.
No instances of price parity or higher pricing appeared on MSE last week, underscoring a consistent discounting strategy.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 11.8% of routes lacked MSE listings last week, a jump of 5.31 pp vs the prior week and 9.84 pp vs the prior month.
No itineraries showed equal pricing on MSE and the website last week or historically, indicating scarce parity cases.
MSE offered lower prices on 88.16% of routes last week, down 5.31 pp week-on-week and 9.84 pp month-on-month, with an average discount of 0.10%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw MSE unavailability rise to 14.4% last week (up 7.76 pp week, 12.48 pp month), with 85.6% priced lower by an average of 0.10%.
Long-haul itineraries maintained 91.8% lower pricing on MSE (avg. –0.10%), while unavailability edged to 8.2% (up 2.04 pp wk, 6.04 pp mo).

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes originating in Iceland had 18.1% MSE unavailability last week (up 8.51 pp wk, 14.79 pp mo) and 81.9% lower pricing at an average discount of 0.08%.
Non-Iceland departures showed just 1.7% unavailability and 98.3% lower pricing on MSE, with a deeper average discount of 0.14%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For bookings inside typical windows, MSE listings were missing 14.95% of the time (up 6.30 pp wk, 12.01 pp mo), with 85.05% lower prices averaging –0.11%.
Far-out itineraries had only 4.44% MSE unavailability (up 2.44 pp wk, 4.44 pp mo) and 95.56% lower pricing with an average discount of 0.09%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Last week 11.8% of FI itineraries were not found on GDS, up from 6.5% previous week and 2.0% previous month.
87.5% of GDS fares matched the website last week, though this share declined from 93.5% week-over-week and 97.3% month-over-month.
Only 0.7% of origin-destination pairs showed lower GDS fares last week, reflecting consistently rare undercutting.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website offers missing in GDS reached 11.8% last week, marking steady increases versus both the prior week and month.
GDS maintained price parity for 87.5% of itineraries last week despite a week-over-week drop of 5.96 percentage points.
Instances of lower GDS fares remained negligible at 0.7% last week, with average discount below 0.1%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 14.6% of offers missing on GDS last week, up from 6.7% week-over-week, while 84.5% held price parity.
Long-haul itineraries registered 8.2% missing offers and 91.8% price parity on GDS last week, with no lower-fare cases.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From Iceland origins, 18.1% of itineraries were missing on GDS last week, driving a price-parity decline to 80.9%.
Non-Iceland points showed near-complete coverage with only 1.7% missing and 98.3% price parity on GDS last week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings had 14.9% missing offers on GDS last week, with price parity at 84.1% and undercuts below 1%.
Far-out bookings recorded 4.4% missing offers and 93.3% price parity on GDS last week, while lower-fare instances rose to 2.2%.
